data.title: Who killed Michael O' Dwyer in England in 1940?Sardar Uddham SinghBina DasShanti GhoshKalpana Datta
data.meta_description: Click here:point_up_2:to get an answer to your question :writing_hand:who killed michael o dwyer in england in 1940
data.text:
Solution

Verified by Toppr

The Jallianwala Bagh massacre took place on 13 April 1919 when troops of the British Indian Army under the command of General Dwyer fired rifles into a crowd of Baisakhi pilgrims, who had gathered in Jallianwala Bagh, Amritsar, Punjab. Udham Singh was a Punjab revolutionary and freedom fighter belonging to the Ghadar Party. He assassinated Michael O' Dwyer, the former Lieutenant Governor of Punjab on 13th March 1940 to avenge the Jallianwala Bagh massacre.
